column2: The only testing is performed by hand after the artifact is created.
Are individual units of source code tested?
Are artifacts deployed and tested in a separate, known, stable environment?
Are tests conducted with the artifact placed in operation with other artifacts?
Does the team trach what lines of code are being tested?
Is code run through scanners to identify bug patterns, security, and quality issues?
Does the team conduct white-box testing of individual components of the system?
Does the team perform some tests correlated to individual acceptance criteria?

column1: Automated tests written as part of story development
column2: As a story or acceptance criteria is being defined, are automated tests written and checked into the code base?
Does the team use a known set of test data against which tests are conducted?
Does the team write tests first then code until the tests pass?
Does the team test the performance of their artifacts?
Does the team test the security of their artifacts?
Are all acceptance criteria validated regressively with automated tests?
Does the team generate scenario-based tests cases for the application then code until those scenarios complete as expected?
Are acceptance tests performed as part of the build and deploy process?
Are performance and load tests performed as part of the build and deploy process?
Are security tests performed as part of the build and deploy process?
Do tests change based on the results of other tests?
Does the team perform manual testing only when risk has been identified?
Does the team perform testing of a transaction from start to completion (e.g. order entry to checkout)?
Are all previous tests run against the current artifact in different configurations?
Does the team verify that the expected value of a change has been realized by the customer?
Can tests be run in the production environment without fear of outage or corruption of data integrity?

column1: Continuous testing pipeline with regression testing
column2: Are all regression tests performed as part of an artifacts build and deploy process?

column1: Defects found and fixed immediately (roll forward)
column2: Are defects prioritized, addressed and deployed immediately without regard to release schedules?
